column2: ENGLISH
Confucian Bureaucracy
The lower tiers of the Chinese Bureaucracy, and the administration of various other realms that have modelled their.
Eastern Imperial

Though not going so far as to claim the Mandate of Heaven, rulers with the Eastern Imperial government emulate the Chinese Imperial system even more thoroughly than those with the Confucian Bureaucracy government.
Japanese Imperial

Though taking some inspiration from the Chinese Imperial government, the Japanese Imperial government is structured somewhat differently and has discarded the concept of the Mandate of Heaven. The Imperial Family's sole right to the Chrysanthemum Throne is universally seen as unquestionable... but the Tenno being a mere figurehead is not necessarily a controversial idea.
Japanese Bureaucracy

Greatly inspired by the government system of the Tang dynasty, the Japanese Bureaucracy government is supposed to be a bureaucratic meritocracy, but many see it as just a stepping stone on the way to something along feudal lines.
Japanese Feudal

While slightly different from the Feudal government, the Japanese Feudal government is a close approximation, with the primary difference being an inability to demand conversion or revoke titles on religious grounds.
Japanese Monastic Feudal
The Japanese Monastic Feudal government is unique among the Japanese governments in that it allows the holder to demand religious conversion
Divine Imperial
Copying the Japanese Imperial government of the Tenno for the most part, the Divine Imperial government is partially bureaucratic and partially theocratic.
Imperial Family deposed
Amaterasu Defied
Amaterasu Defied

[Root.GetTennoKogo] [From.GetFirstName] has died without an heir. While [From.GetSheHe] was a mortal [From.GetManWoman] like any other and [From.GetHerHis] death thus was to be expected sooner or later, the lack of a member of the Imperial Family to inherit the Chrysanthemum Throne is unprecedented, seeing as the Imperial Family has possessed it since time immemorial.\n\nWith the succession unclear, [Root.GetTennoKogo] [From.GetFirstName]'s former realm has crumbled, and the belief of many of the Shinto faithful has crumbled alongside it, with many abandoning their faith altogether.
The unthinkable has happened!
I suppose Buddhism has its appeal...
It is time for me to openly convert...
So much for those "Ten thousand years!"...
Tenno
Kogo
Having become a ruler in my own right it is time for me to decide whether I favor the government of a warrior, similar to that of [FromFrom.GetBestName], or a more bureaucratic government.
A warrior's government for me!
A bureaucratic government sounds rather nice...
Having become a ruler in my own right it is time for me to decide whether I favor a more priesly government, similar to that of [FromFrom.GetBestName], or a more bureaucratic government.
I must follow [Root.Religion.GetHighGod]'s plan!

I guess I have a regent. For now...
Banzai! Banzai! Banzai!
I have finally become the [Root.GetTitle], and all the power and authority of the position now belongs to me. Unfortunately, this power and authority is not as vast as it could be.
I guess I have a regent. For now...

I guess I have a regent. For now...
The Chrysanthemum Throne is mine once more, and so is all the power and authority that comes with it.
Excellent!

It seems [From.GetBestName] has leveraged [From.GetHerHis] considerable influence at court to secure more power for [From.GetHerselfHimself] at my expense. Sadly, I am in no position to oppose this for the time being.
[From.GetSheHeCap] forgets [From.GetHerHis] place...

Even though there are many in [From.GetBestName]'s court that are well aware that it is in the interest of the realm for me to have rather considerable authority it seems [From.GetBestName] has still managed to leverage [From.GetHerHis] influence to somewhat reduce my authority.
[From.GetSheHeCap] is perhaps not content as a puppet...

[Root.GetBestName]
I have decided that it would be in the interest of the realm for you to marry [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]. I have taken the liberty of ensuring that the wedding can take place immediately.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetBestName]
I guess I have a new wife...

[From.GetBestName] has come to the conclusion that some of my wealth would be better in [From.GetHerHis] hands. [From.GetSheHeCap] claims that [From.GetSheHe] will be spending it in a fashion that will benefit the realm, but I have my doubts that that is the truth.
[From.GetSheHeCap] is just a common thief!

[From.GetBestName] came to see me today and wasted no time before informing me that [From.GetSheHe] thinks it would be best for the realm if I spent the next year far, far away from government affairs. [From.GetSheHeCap] also let me know that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to assign me a large number of guards to ensure everything goes as planned.
I... have no choice...
I have just received word that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to release [From.GetBestName] from prison, supposedly acting in my name.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] didn't even ask me!
I have just received word that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to execute one of my prisoners, [From.GetBestName], supposedly acting in my name.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] didn't even ask me!

It seems [FromFrom.GetBestName] has decided that [From.GetBestName] being on the council is not to [FromFrom.GetHerHis] liking, as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has let [From.GetBestName] know that [From.GetHerHis] presence no longer is desired.
At least [From.GetBestName] does not blame me...

I have just been informed by [FromFrom.GetBestName] that I am not welcome at any more council meetings for the time being, supposedly because the realm would benefit more from someone else in my old position.
This wasn't [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s idea!

[Root.GetBestName]
It is clear to me that the realm would be better served by [From.GetBestName] being my direct vassal, and I have taken the necessary steps to ensure that this indeed is the case.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetBestName]
I am in no position to oppose this...

[ROOT:GetBestName]
It is clear to me that the realm is better served by you being my direct vassal, and I have taken the necessary steps to ensure that this is indeed the case.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetBestName]
I suppose that's fine...
I have a bad feeling about this...

[Root.GetBestName]
It is clear to me that it would be best for the realm if I personally held [From.GetName], and I have taken the necessary steps to ensure that this indeed is the case.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetBestName]
I am in no position to oppose this...

[Root.GetBestName],
It is apparent to everyone that you currently are unfit to serve as the Permanent Regent, and everyone agrees that I should serve in your stead. I am sure you will see things my way, at least in time.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
I'll remember this!

[Root.GetBestName],
I am pleased to inform you that our combined efforts have paid off. I am now the Permanent Regent for [Root.Liege.GetBestName], and my tenure will continue indefinitely, for the good of the realm.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
Excellent!

[Root.GetBestName],
Your former Permanent Regent was obviously unfit to serve, so I have taken the liberty to take over the Permanent Regency. For the good of the realm, this state of things will of course continue indefinitely.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
I suppose this is no worse...

[Root.GetBestName],
It is clear that the realm would only benefit from a Permanent Regency under me. I suggest that you agree with this demand, as I and my backers otherwise will compel you by force of arms.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
I suppose I can accept this...
Never!

I assume you wish to know that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has been named as my Permanent Regent and that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will be in charge of a Permanent Regency.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
Excellent!

[Root.GetBestName],
In the interests of the realm as a whole, I have decided to accept that making you my Permanent Regent and agreeing to a Permanent Regency is a wise course of action.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
Assuming indirect control!

[Root.GetBestName],
Your claim that a Permanent Regency would be best for the realm is false, and your attempt to take power from me is treason. My armies will be coming to arrest you and those who would side with you.

Recent Regency Power change
This ruler's Permanent Regent has recently gained or lost power.
Forced aside
This ruler's Permanent Regent has forced them into secluded meditation for the time being, completely preventing any interference in government affairs.
Forced off the council
The Permanent Regent has forced this character off the council
Failed to overthrow Permanent Regent
Due to a failed attempt to end the Permanent Regency this ruler is unable to govern at present.
Regency Power
Controls the influence of the Permanent Regent. These laws are passed using regular decisions.
Minimal

The Permanent Regent has very limited authority.
- The Permanent Regent may use a targeted decision to marry an adult male liege to a member of their dynasty, demoting any existing spouse to the rank of consort.
- The Permanent Regent has considerable influence in their liege's succession by virtue of being the Permanent Regent, and the liege's influence is reduced by virtue of having a Permanent Regency.
- The Permanent Regent's influence in their liege's succession increases with each Regency Power law passed, and their liege's influence decreases with each Regency Power law passed.
Minor

The Permanent Regent has slightly more authority.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can, if duke-tier or above, transfer count-tier vassals from their liege using a targeted decision targeting the vassal.
-As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can, if duke-tier or above, transfer count-tier vassals from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a targeted decision targeting the vasal. The Tenno's Permanent Regent cannot be transferred.
- Members of the Permanent Regent's dynasty that either are count-tier or above or that are close relatives of the Permanent Regent can no longer be fired by the Permanent Regent's liege.
Limited

Though the Permanent Regent has been given some authority it is still fairly limited.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer counties from their liege. The liege's capital county cannot be transferred, nor Yamashiro if the liege possesses the Chrysanthemum Throne.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer counties from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a title decision. Their respective capital counties cannot be transferred, nor can Yamashiro be transferred if it is held by the Tenno.
- The Permanent Regent can release their liege's prisoners using a targeted decision found on the prisoner.
Average

Most people would agree that the Permanent Regent neither has significant power nor has particularly limited power.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can transfer a significant amount of money from their liege's treasury, using a regular decision.
- The Permanent Regent can, if king-tier, transfer duke-tier vassals from their liege using a targeted decision targeting the vassal.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can, if king-tier, transfer duke-tier vassals from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a targeted decision targeting the vasal. The Tenno's Permanent Regent cannot be transferred.
Expanded

The Permanent Regent's powers have been expanded considerably.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer duchies from their liege, assuming the liege is at least king-tier. Religious titles cannot be transferred.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer duchies from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a title decision. The Permanent Regent's primary title cannot be transferred.
- The Permanent Regent's liege is no longer allowed to fire any member of the Permanent Regent's dynasty from the council.
Major

The Permanent Regent's authority is quite significant indeed.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can execute their liege's prisoners using a targeted decision found on the prisoner. The liege's dynasty members cannot be targeted.
- The Permanent Regent can fire their liege's council members using a targeted decision found on the council member.
Unparalleled

The Permanent Regent's authority has never been greater than it currently is.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer kingdoms from their liege, assuming the liege holds an emperor-tier title. The Chrysanthemum Throne cannot be transferred.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer kingdoms from the Tenno using a title decision. The Chrysanthemum Throne cannot be transferred.
- The Permanent Regent can use a decision to force their liege into an even more restrictive regency for a year.
Chrysanthemum Throne Succession
Chrysanthemum Throne Succession

Succession to the Chrysanthemum Throne is limited to patrilineal descendants from Tenno Jimmu that still are part of the Imperial Family, with the heir being selected based on the approval of members from the Imperial Family and certain other influential people.

Change to the Japanese Bureaucracy government type
Though some would find a bureaucratic government unnecessarily restrictive, perhaps there is some wisdom in governing in a more bureaucratic fashion.
Change to the Japanese Feudal government type
Though perhaps not a government that would appeal to everyone, a feudal government would be rather fitting for a warrior at least.
Change to the Japanese Monastic Feudal government type
Though some would frown on temporal and spiritual power held by the same individual, those that truly belive in the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith would quite possibly find it only natural.
Recreate Japan
Though possession of the Chrysanthemum Throne naturally implies being the lawful ruler of Japan there are those that only would accept this as the truth if certain specific steps are taken...
Make Yamashiro the capital
The traditional capital of Japan is of course located in Yamashiro, but right now the official capital is not. Taking steps to correct this inconsistency would be a good idea.
Found Heian-kyo

Japan needs a proper capital, and there is a promising site for one in Yamashiro. I should allocate the necessary funds and proclaim the founding of a capital, and the beginning of a new period of Japanese history.
The county of Yamashiro becomes the capital.
Integrate Ezo
Though not part of the Eight Great Islands of Japan, the island of Ezo surely belongs to the Rising Sun...
Integrate Ryukyu
Though not part of the Eight Great Islands of Japa, the Ryukyuan Islands surely belong to the Rising Sun...
The Kingdom of Ezo has no holder, is held by you, or is held by a vassal with an appropriate government type of yours
The Kingdom of Ryukyu has no holder, is held by you, or is held by a vassal with an appropriate government type of yours
Transfer money from liege
As the Permanent Regent I can take some of my liege's wealth to spend as I desire, as long as I claim it is for the good of the realm.
Force liege aside

If it is of critical importance that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] does not interfere with the Permanent Regency I can take steps to ensure that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is unable to do so. I cannot do this too frequently, however.
Increase Regency Power
Perhaps the time has come for my authority as [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent to be expanded even further.
Decrease Regency Power
My Permanent Regent has far too much authority. If ending the Permanent Regency outright is not currently an option, perhaps I could at least reduce [Root.Regent.GetHerHis] authority somewhat.
Overthrow my Permanent Regent

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.
Overthrow my Permanent Regent

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.
Overthrow my Permanent Regent

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.
End the Permanent Regency
With there being no Permanent Regent, it is clear that there can be no Permanent Regency.
Arrange marriage

As the Permanent Regent it would only be right and proper to make sure that [Root.GetBestName] is married to someone from my dynasty, and this would perhaps help ensure that [Root.GetHerHis] heir is more likely to listen to me or my successor.
Release prisoner
I can order [Root.GetBestName] released from [From.Liege.GetBestName]'s prison using my authority as the Permanent Regent.
Execute prisoner
I can order [Root.GetBestName] executed using my authority as the Permanent Regent. However, everyone would know that it was my decision, so I should not do this carelessly....
Fire councillor
It would perhaps be in my interest to ensure that [Root.GetBestName] no longer serves on [From.Liege.GetBestName]'s council. As Permanent Regent, I can easily get [Root.GetHerHim] fired.

Grand Chancellor
Entrusted with considerable power and wielding considerable influence, the Grand Chancellor is not to be trifled with.
Eunuch influence
Controls the number of Council Eunuchs and the amount of influence they possess.
No Eunuchs
The eunuchs are in their rightful place: Out of sight, out of mind.
Eunuchs Insignificant
The sole representative for the eunuchs on the council can most likely be safely ignored.
Eunuchs Average
The eunuchs are making their presence felt on the council, but their support is not always necessary.
Eunuchs Significant
The support of at least a few of the eunuchs is most likely required for anything to be approved by the council.
Eunuchs Overwhelming
The influence of the eunuchs has not been greater since the days of the Ten Attendants. Their will be done.
Grand Chancellor influence
Controls the extent of the Grand Chancellor's influence and power.
Grand Chancellor Decent
The Grand Chancellor is reasonably influential.
Grand Chancellor Significant
The Grand Chancellor has more influence than many would say is proper.
Grand Chancellor Overwhelming
The Grand Chancellor's influence is such that many feel that a comparison with the likes of Cao Cao or Dong Zhuo would be quite fitting.
Court influence
Controls the amount of influence wielded by courtiers that are not Council Eunuchs.
Courtiers Insignificant
Members of the court are largely unable to influence the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.
Courtiers Limited
Various members of the court formally have some influence, but for most it is only ceremonial.
Courtiers Average
While the amount of influence wielded by members of the court does not please everyone, many would say it is at a reasonable level.
Courtiers Significant
Courtiers on the council have a significant amount of influence.
Courtiers Overwhelming
Several members of the court are exceptionally influential.
Vassal influence
Controls the amount of influence wielded by vassals, as well as various laws limiting their powers.
Vassals Controlled
Vassals are held on a short leash, as is only right and proper.
Vassals Weak
Some minor concessions have been made by the central government, mainly in the name of reducing the amount of work for various government ministers.
Vassals Average
Further authority has been delegated to vassals, most likely not to the liking of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.
Vassals Strong
The central government is no longer in a position to recover land held by vassals save by inheritance, and titles can only be granted in a hereditary fashion.
Vassals Unrestrained
The bureaucratic structure of the realm has all but collapsed, quite possibly a sign interesting times lie ahead.
